content:
Meeting 2021-08-10T17:00:00+02:00

Agenda:

  • Triage
  • Metadata Collector move retrospect
  • ...?
T-15min
I wanted to hear takes on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/7543
Feels pedantic to me
Meeting time :wave:
About triage: I still have to do a backport from beta to Rust repo beta branch. I'll do this with the sync on Thursday.
Are there any issues I should take care of before the sync? @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Ok, about the move to the new metadata collector:
It went pretty well, and is now up and running without any problems for the last 2 weeks, so that's good
I'll have to do manual beta and stable releases for 2 more release cycles though.

What I noticed today, was that we now get deploy commits like this: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/commit/3968eeaadbd7a24907db6b0be719515f6ab51490

Here only line numbers where the lint is defined change.
This shouldn't lead to any problems though.
Famous last words :smiling_face:
I also think that the switch went quite well. We've used a rollup PR to merge all connected PRs together which worked out quite well IMO
In the last 2 weeks 3 out of 6 commits were just such line changes, so it shouldn't generate too much churn.
I think nobody really looks at the lints JSON file or it's history, so having such commits should be fine :upside_down:
We could avoid these commits by not linking from the documentation website to the code. But I quite like this feature. So what do you think?
I thought about changing the jump target location to the actual lint emission code. That would probably lead to even more line change commits but might be more useful for the types/methods module
Multiple lints have multiple emission sides, so that might be a problem.
I'm in favor of keeping that functionality either way, I'm sometimes using it when I want to link an example lint
I think the current behavior is fine for now @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

flip1995 said:

Multiple lints have multiple emission sides, so that might be a problem.

True, I would try it as an example. The main point is that the file would probably always be correct :upside_down:

Ok great! Now to the linked PR by @Manish Goregaokar. Here's a direct link to the lint definition: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/7543/files#diff-be4b3cb9a875d8a032b0b612ead8f4dbe5eb821dae62d2674ec57e451c1273f8R14-R38
Looking at that, this also seems to be pedantic to me.
I also think that's pedantic.
I feel like consistency is not established style
So I'm not even sure of pedantic
But maybe that's fine
I would also consider this to be a pedantic mostly because it requires a configuration value and would therefore have a default configuration.
I see that there's a config option Ignore in the current implementation, which is also the default. Does the lint even trigger if this is set?
No it doesn't
So this would be a lint, you could only enable through the config file.
Ok, so the lint doesn't even trigger by default, I don't think this is a good argument to put it in style.
Yeah, me neither
I see the point of this lint, but I think it's hard to categorize
What about changing the lint to just detect if modules are defined in different ways. So sometimes via <name>/mod.rs and <name>.rs in the same crate.
Feels like a restriction IMO
Maybe restriction, with an explicit note in the doc that it has to be enabled in the config file (additionally)

xFrednet said:

What about changing the lint to just detect if modules are defined in different ways. So sometimes via <name>/mod.rs and <name>.rs in the same crate.

If we put it in restriction with a config option, I think the lint doesn't have to be that complicated
Yeah, the config default should definitely be noted.

flip1995 said:

xFrednet said:

What about changing the lint to just detect if modules are defined in different ways. So sometimes via <name>/mod.rs and <name>.rs in the same crate.

If we put it in restriction with a config option, I think the lint doesn't have to be that complicated

I would agree for a restriction lint :+1:
To do otherwise would just invite bug reports.
Then I think we're on the same page here @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.

Last but not least:

I want to welcome out newest team member @xFrednet to the Clippy team :tada: I'm looking forward to (continue) working with you :)
Welcome @xFrednet !
Thank you!!!
That's it for today @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks for attending everyone! :wave:
Thanks for running the meeting, @flip1995 !
I also wanted to say a big THANK YOU to everyone on the team for all the advice and support that I've received so far :blush:
